text:
Pt 80yo female S/P recent hospitalization at [**Hospital1 3633**] with CP, she was
   cathed and found to have 3VD, 95% LM not intervened on in cath lab and
   surgery felt she was too high risk for surgery. She was DC
d home and
   then had reoccurrence of chest pain 2 days later, ruled in at [**Hospital1 4328**] for STEMI ( Inferior MI). Peak cpk 1350. Sent here for
   re-evalulation CABG.  Pt admitted on heparin and ntg, NTG weaned off
   [**7-29**], remains on heparin. Surgery came by to see pt and now have
   cardiac cath films from [**Hospital1 3633**] as of [**7-30**].
   *Temp pacing wire inserted [**7-30**] for bradycardia 28-30 Afib s/p inferior
   MI.  Has experienced some confusion over past few days but cooperative
   w/ care. Alert and oriented x [**2-16**].  Supportive dtrs have been staying
   with pt, [**Name (NI) **] at bedside overnight to translate. Renal consulted [**7-31**]
   for poor urine output and rising creat. Liver also following.
   Lisinopril and Cardiac meds currently on hold.
   .
   Coronary artery disease (CAD, ischemic heart disease)
   Assessment:
   Temp pacing wire placed [**7-30**] for bradycardic Afib 20s-30s in setting of
   new inferior STEMI.  VVI @ 70 BPM. Appropriate sensing and capture.
   RIJ site CDI. BP 90s/40s-50s w/ MAPs>60. Denied CP/SOB.  IV heparin gtt
   therapeutic @ 400 units/hr.
   Action:
   Temp wire tested per protocol, mA captures at 2.5  (set MA to 7) and
   sensitivity threshold 2.0
   Sensitivity set to 1.  Pt
s intrinsic rhythm apparent during testing
   and throughout shift: atrial fibrillation@ 50-60sBPM.  Cont
d IV
   heparin gtt. Continue to hold cardiac meds.
   Response:
   *HR 70s V-paced w/ appropriate sensing. Occasional failure to capture
   beat. Intrinsic rhythm now improved to 50s-60s AF. BP w/ maps in 60s.
   Plan:
   *Continue to monitor hemodynamics. Cont temp transvenous pacing.
   *Continue IV heparin. Holding BP/HR meds.
   * Cardiac surgery evaluating pt for potential CABG- awaiting their
   review of cath lab films from OSH and input from other consulted teams.
   *Renal following for ARF
   *Hepatology following given pt
s hx of HCV cirrhosis which puts her at
   a higher surgical risk. Awaiting liver MRI report for OSH which
   daughter will pick up today.
   * Plan today [**8-1**] for meeting w/ pt
s family/ CCU team/ ?CSURG team to
   discuss goals of care and plans for possible surgery.
   Renal failure, acute (Acute renal failure, ARF)
   Assessment:
   Low urine output, though improved from last night @  mainly 20 ml per
   hour average. RIJ cordis transduced for CVP [**Location (un) **]: [**11-27**]. Pt with new
   UTI per UA, intermittent c/o suprapubic discomfort.
   Action:
   Started on PO cipro for UTI. Foley cath changed. Renal following pt.
   Monitored UOP/ BUN/Creat. FENA<1%. No IVF ordered over night.
   Response:
   Pt continues to have low urine output. Creat stable. Prerenal vs ATN.
   Plan:
   Continue to monitor UOP, BUN/Creat.  Monitor closely for hypotension.
   Avoid nephrotoxins.
   Goal CVP is 15.
